questions.question: Which of the following groups became the main residents of the inner city during the Gilded Age?

choices.answer: clerks and teachers
doctors and lawyers
the wealthy
the working poor

questions.question: Which of the following was a typical tactic of nativists in the early 1900s?

choices.answer: registering immigrants to vote
campaigning for pro-immigration laws
bullying and intimidating immigrants
paying immigrants to move out of cities

questions.question: By the end of the 1800s, the Chinese immigration rate dramatically

choices.answer: decreased because of the Chinese Exclusion Act.
decreased because of a war in China.
increased because of a gold rush.
increased because of job opportunities.

questions.question: Many Americans feared that immigrants who passed through Angel Island would :

choices.answer: have to return to their home countries.
assimilate into American culture.
claim American land to build farms.
take jobs from Americans workers.

questions.question: What is the definition of a strike?

choices.answer: a union strategy involving work stoppage designed to put pressure on an emp
a union strategy in which workers stop buying an employer’s goods until the
negotiations by union leaders on behalf of a group of workers in an attempt
the refusal of union leaders to allow certain groups of people to join

questions.question: Which is one reason that factory work was dangerous in the 1800s?

choices.answer: Machines were too difficult for workers to use.
There were not enough workers to operate large machines.
Most machines had few safety features.
There were not enough machines to meet demand for products.

questions.question: Why did manufacturers hire children to work in their factories?

choices.answer: Factory owners could pay children less money than they paid adults.
Children were able to complete more work than adults.
Children could work for eight hours per day.
Factory owners expected children to do demanding physical labor.

questions.question: This man invented the light bulb and helped bring electricity to cities

choices.answer: Thomas Edison
Alexander Graham Bell
AndrewCarnegie
JohnD Rockefeller

questions.question: This man built a monopoly in the oil business

choices.answer: Thomas Edison
Alexander Graham Bell
AndrewCarnegie
John D Rockefeller

questions.question: In the Gilded age, how did monopolies affect many small businesses?

choices.answer: Monopolies provided customers for small businesses.
Monopolies helped small businesses grow.
Monopolies had no effect on small businesses.
Monopolies forced small businesses to shut down.

questions.question: What kind of relationship did the US government have with the railroad companies?

choices.answer: The railroads were owned by the government
The railroads would get free/cheap land from the government
The government tried to break up the railroad monopolies

questions.question: The idea that only “the best” businesses and entrepreneurs can succeed. Aka - "survival of the fittest".

choices.answer: FreeEnterprise
Entrepreneur
Anti-trustlaws
Social Darwinism
